metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7529 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
sosreport in SoS 3.x allows local users to obtain sensitive information from sosreport files or gain privileges via a symlink attack on an archive file in a temporary directory, as demonstrated by sosreport-$hostname-$date.tar in /tmp/sosreport-$hostname-$date.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.1-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu2.2').
